LinkedBinarySearchTree

public LinkedBinarySearchTree()
Creates an empty binary search tree.

LinkedBinarySearchTree

public LinkedBinarySearchTree(T element)
Creates a binary search with the specified element as its root.

Parameters:
element - the element that will be the root of the new binary search tree
Method Detail

addElement

public void addElement(T element)
Adds the specified object to the binary search tree in the appropriate position according to its key value. Note that equal elements are added to the right.

Specified by:
addElement in interface BinarySearchTreeADT<T>
Parameters:
element - the element to be added to the binary search tree

removeElement

public T removeElement(T targetElement)
                throws jss2.exceptions.ElementNotFoundException
Removes the first element that matches the specified target element from the binary search tree and returns a reference to it. Throws a ElementNotFoundException if the specified target element is not found in the binary search tree.

Specified by:
removeElement in interface BinarySearchTreeADT<T>
Parameters:
targetElement - the element being sought in the binary search tree
Returns:
the element removed from this tree
Throws:
jss2.exceptions.ElementNotFoundException - if an element not found exception occurs

removeMin

public T removeMin()
            throws jss2.exceptions.EmptyCollectionException
Removes the node with the least value from the binary search tree and returns a reference to its element. Throws an EmptyBinarySearchTreeException if this tree is empty.

Specified by:
removeMin in interface BinarySearchTreeADT<T>
Returns:
a reference to the node with the least value
Throws:

removeMax

public T removeMax()
            throws jss2.exceptions.EmptyCollectionException
Removes the node with the highest value from the binary search tree and returns a reference to its element. Throws an EmptyBinarySearchTreeException if this tree is empty.

findMin

public T findMin()
          throws jss2.exceptions.EmptyCollectionException
Returns the element with the least value in the binary search tree. It does not remove the node from the binary search tree. Throws an EmptyBinarySearchTreeException if this tree is empty.

Specified by:
findMin in interface BinarySearchTreeADT<T>
Returns:
the element with the least value
Throws:
jss2.exceptions.EmptyCollectionException - if an empty collection exception occurs

findMax

public T findMax()
          throws jss2.exceptions.EmptyCollectionException
Returns the element with the highest value in the binary search tree. It does not remove the node from the binary search tree. Throws an EmptyBinarySearchTreeException if this tree is empty.

Specified by:
findMax in interface BinarySearchTreeADT<T>
Returns:
the element with the highest value
Throws:
jss2.exceptions.EmptyCollectionException - if an empty collection exception occurs

find

public T find(T targetElement)
       throws jss2.exceptions.ElementNotFoundException
Returns a reference to the specified target element if it is found in the binary tree. Throws a NoSuchElementException if the specified target element is not found in this tree.

Specified by:
find in interface BinaryTreeADT<T>
Overrides:
find in class LinkedBinaryTree<T>
Parameters:
targetElement - the element being sough in the binary tree
Returns:
a reference to the specified target
Throws:
jss2.exceptions.ElementNotFoundException - if an element not found exception occurs

replacement

protected BinaryTreeNode<T> replacement(BinaryTreeNode<T> node)
Returns a reference to a node that will replace the one specified for removal. In the case where the removed node has two children, the inorder successor is used as its replacement.

Parameters:
node - the node to be removeed
Returns:
a reference to the replacing node
